title: Basic Option Strategies
description: Learn fundamental options strategies including covered calls and protective puts to enhance your trading toolkit.
introduction: Options offer a wide range of strategies for different market conditions and risk profiles. Let's explore two of the most popular and practical strategies: covered calls and protective puts.

coveredCall.title: Covered Call Strategy
coveredCall.description: A covered call involves selling a call option against stock you already own.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.p1: You own 100 shares of a stock and sell one call option contract (representing 100 shares) at a strike price above the current market price.
howItWorks.p2: You receive a premium for selling the call option, which provides income and some downside protection.

benefits.title: Benefits
benefits.downsideProtection: Provides some protection against small declines in stock price
benefits.reducedCost: Lowers your effective cost basis in the stock

risks.title: Risks
risks.limitedUpside: Your upside potential is limited to the strike price plus the premium received
risks.obligation: You're obligated to sell your shares if the option is exercised

protectivePut.title: Protective Put Strategy
protectivePut.description: A protective put involves buying a put option to protect against downside risk in a stock you own.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.p1: You own 100 shares of a stock and buy one put option contract at a strike price below the current market price.
howItWorks.p2: If the stock price falls below the strike price, the put option increases in value, offsetting some of your losses.

benefits.title: Benefits
benefits.downsideProtection: Limits your maximum loss to the difference between current price and strike price, minus the premium paid
benefits.unlimitedUpside: You maintain unlimited upside potential on the stock
benefits.peaceOfMind: Provides insurance against significant market declines

risks.title: Risks
risks.premiumCost: You pay a premium for the put option, which reduces your overall returns
risks.timeDecay: The put option loses value over time due to theta decay

whenToUse.title: When to Use Each Strategy
whenToUse.coveredCall: Use covered calls when you're moderately bullish on a stock and want to generate income
whenToUse.protectivePut: Use protective puts when you're concerned about downside risk but want to maintain upside potential

keyTakeaways.title: Key Takeaways
keyTakeaways.takeaway1: Covered calls generate income but limit upside potential.
keyTakeaways.takeaway2: Protective puts provide downside protection but cost money in premiums.
keyTakeaways.takeaway3: Both strategies can be effective for managing risk and enhancing returns.
keyTakeaways.takeaway4: Always understand the risks and obligations before implementing these strategies.
